evidence.pdf_reference: evolve over all of catalysts in which the maximum production rate of methane, 1.860 mmolg-cat h is measured on Cu(0.5 wt)-Fe(0.5wt)TiO 2 -SiO 2 -acac catalyst coated over optical fiber.Meanwhile ethylene is only produced on catalysts doped with Cu and Fe metals.The largest production rate of ethylene, 0.575 mmolg-cat h is observed on Cu(0.5 wt)-Fe(0.5wt)TiO 2 coated over optical fiber. In order to efficiently utilize real sunlight for photoreduction of CO 2 to fuels, solar concentrator is employed to

h, respectively.For the former catalyst, the increase in light intensity is not found to compensate the inherent electron-hole recombination in the TiO 2 -SiO 2 -acac catalyst, whereas the superior photoactivity of Cu-FeTiO 2 -SiO 2 catalyst under natural sunlight could be ascribed to its full absorption of visible light.

An optical-fiber reactor is employed to photocatalytically reduce CO 2 with H 2 O to fuels under UVA artificial light and concentrated natural sunlight.The optical fiber is coated with gel-derived TiO 2 -SiO 2 mixed oxide-based photocatalysts.Fe atom is found to insert into the TiO 2 -SiO 2 lattice during sol-gel process, resulting in the full visible light absorption as well as the effect on product selectivity of the derived catalyst.Under UVA, ethylene is mainly produced on Cu-FeTiO 2 catalyst with the

energy could be ascribed to the substitution of Ti ions by Fe counterparts in the TiO 2 -SiO 2 lattice. In this study, Cu-FeTiO 2 -SiO 2 catalysts are observed to photoreduce CO 2 with H 2 O to various kinds of products that include significant amount of ethylene and methane as well as trace amount of ethane and methanol.The reactor is covered with a heating tape to maintain the reaction at around 75 1C to assure that all of light hydrocarbons could reach the GC detector.Consequently, there is no

on Cu-FeTiO 2 catalyst with the quantum yield of 0.0235, whereas Cu-Fe TiO 2 -SiO 2 catalyst is observed to favor methane production with the quantum yield of 0.05.Meanwhile, the overall energy efficiency is found to be much higher on Cu-FeTiO 2 -SiO 2 (0.0182) than on its Cu-FeTiO 2 counterpart (0.0159).There is only methane evolved over both bare TiO 2 -SiO 2 and Cu-FeTiO 2 -SiO 2 catalysts under natural sunlight with the production rates of 0.177 and 0.279 mmolgcat h, respectively.For the former

evidence.pdf_reference: An optical-fiber reactor is employed to photocatalytically reduce CO 2 with H 2 O to fuels under UVA artificial light and concentrated natural sunlight.The optical fiber is coated with gel-derived TiO 2 -SiO 2 mixed oxide-based photocatalysts.Fe atom is found to insert into the TiO 2 -SiO 2 lattice during sol-gel process, resulting in the full visible light absorption as well as the effect on product selectivity of the derived catalyst.Under UVA, ethylene is mainly produced on Cu-FeTiO 2 catalyst with the

of bare carrier.Owing to the too small amount of catalyst coated on one optical fiber, the amount of catalyst coated on this carrier is measured on the basis of the total number of optical fibers in the photoreactor, which are 216 fibers. Photocatalytic reaction was carried out in a continuous circular Pyrex glass reactor (216 cm 3 ) with a quartz window for conduction of light irradiation.Catalyst-coated optical fibers were inserted in the reactor in a way such that the light source (high-pressure Hg

concentrator is employed to conduct sunlight into the reactor.The production rate of methane over TiO 2 -SiO 2 mixed oxide-based catalysts under natural sunlight on some specific days are depicted in Table 3.When optical fiber is used as a catalyst carrier, methane evolution is higher on Cu(0.5 wt)-Fe(0.5wt)TiO 2 -SiO 2 -acac catalyst (0.279 mmolg-cat h) than that on bare TiO 2 -SiO 2 -acac counterpart (0.177 mmolg-cat h).Because natural sunlight is dependent on the weather of the day when the experiment

light gradually spreads and diminishes to the end of the fiber. the top of the catalyst bed to maintain the reaction at around 75 1C.The reactor was purged by CO 2 gas bubbling through distilled water for 1 h at 75 1C before and during the reaction.The space velocity of CO 2 gas and H 2 O vapor was maintained at 0.72 h A1 for every experiment.The outlet gases were analyzed at some periods of time by using GC equipped with FID and porapak Q column.Z 14 combustion heat of methane ethylene A moles of methane ethylene yield A 100 hn A moles of photon absorbed by catalyst
